{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3421646,"name":"Carl Hauser","username":"chauser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a587f6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-07T16:36:41.541Z","cooked":"

Last summer I fixed a number of issues in the SmartDashboard program and these got released with WPILib in 2024. SmartDashboard is largely orphaned at this point. However, my team still prefers it as the drivers’ competition dashboard. I’ll explain why in a later post. What I’d like to get a sense of with this poll is how many teams are using SmartDashboard and why? This will help me decide how much more effort I’m willing to put into further updates and how strong a case can be made for continuing to have SmartDashboard as part of the WPILib package down the road.

(Note: this refers to the SmartDashboard dashboard program, not to the SmartDashboard class used within robot programs which is a related, but entirely different, thing.)

My team’s use of the SmartDashboard program
  • We used SmartDashboard in 2024
  • We did not use SmartDashboard in 2024
  • We expect to use SmartDashboard in 2025
  • We do not expect to use SmartDashboard in 2025
0 voters

If you expect to use SmartDashboard in the future it would be helpful if you would make a reply post with a bit of detail about what you use it for (drivers? development and testing?) and why SmartDashboard serves that role better than alternative dashboards (e.g. Shuffleboard, Glass, Elastic, etc.).

program"}]},{"id":3421648,"name":"Carl Hauser","username":"chauser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a587f6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-07T16:41:25.097Z","cooked":"

My team uses SmartDashboard for our drivers in competition. The main reason is the simplicity in that role: we only need one or two choosers and a small handful of indicators along with a streaming camera view. We don’t care about the ability to lay out the dashboard from within robot code nor do we need to do logging from the dashboard. For development and diagnosis we rely on Glass and nowadays we use on-robot logging and AdvantageScope for log analysis.
